sen.j: 宗厳（そうごん、天正3年（1575年）? - 寛永5年（1628年））は李氏朝鮮の人。
sen.e: Sogon (1575?-1628) was a person from Yi Dynasty Korea.
Sogon (1575?-1628) was a person from Yi Dynasty Korea.
Sogon (1575?-1628) was a person from Yi Dynasty Korea.

sen.j: 後に出家して僧となり、西雲院を開山した。
sen.e: He later entered into priesthood and founded Saiun-in Temple.
He later entered into priesthood and founded Saiun-in Temple.
He later entered into priesthood and founded Saiun-in Temple.

sen.j: 豊臣秀吉が起こした文禄・慶長の役の時に秀吉の家来の小野木重勝に捕らえられて、日本に連れてこられた。
sen.e: At the time of the Bunroku-Keicho War triggered by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, Sogon was captured by Hideyoshi's retainer Shigekatsu ONOGI and brought to Japan.
At the time of the Bunroku-Keicho War provoked by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, Sogon was captured by Hideyoshi's retainer Shigekatsu ONOGI and brought to Japan.
At the time of the Bunroku-Keicho War provoked by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, Sogon was captured by Hideyoshi's retainer Shigekatsu ONOGI and brought to Japan.

sen.j: 縁起に「宗厳天質、陰茎至小にして男事すでに絶つ」とある。
sen.e: According to engi (writing about the history), there is a description which says 'Sogon has a very small penis and already given up his manhood.'
sen.cmt: 「宗厳天質、陰茎至小にして男事すでに絶つ」の部分は意味を推測して訳しています。
sen.e: According to engi (writing about the history), there is a description which says 'Sogon has a very small penis and already gave up his manhood.'
According to engi (writing about the history), there is a description which says 'Sogon has a very small penis and already gave up his manhood.'

sen.j: そのためやんごとない婦人に仕えさせるには安心だった。
sen.e: Therefore, it was safe for Sogon to serve women of royal family.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, He was suitable for serving ladies of high rank.
sen.cmt: 原文は「宗厳にとって安心だった」のではなく、婦人（もしくはその父・夫）にとって安心だったと思われるので、そのように訳しなおしました。「やんごとない」は（下セルからも判断し）貴族・皇室とは限らないので、変更しました。
sen.e: Therefore, He was suitable for serving ladies of high rank.

sen.j: 蜂須賀家政が高台院に彼を献上した。
sen.e: Iemasa HACHISUKA offered Sogon to Kodai-in.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Iemasa HACHISUKA offered Sogon to Kodaiin.
sen.cmt: 指示書に従いハイフン削除しました。
sen.e: Iemasa HACHISUKA offered Sogon to Kodaiin.

sen.j: 北政所は彼を羽柴下総守（滝川雄利）の息女の召し使いにした。
sen.e: Kita no Mandokoro (legal wife of regent or chief adviser to the Emperor) made him a servant for the daughter of Hashiba Shimousa no kami (Hashiba, governor of Shimosa Province)(Katsutoshi TAKIGAWA).
Kita no Mandokoro (legal wife of regent or chief adviser to the Emperor) made him a servant for a daughter of Hashiba Shimousa no kami (Hashiba, governor of Shimosa Province)(Katsutoshi TAKIGAWA).
sen.cmt: 高台院と北政所は同一人物なので統一するのが望ましいと思いますが、原文に従い北政所のままとしました。冠詞変更しました。
sen.e: Kita no Mandokoro (legal wife of regent or chief adviser to the Emperor) made him a servant for a daughter of Hashiba Shimousa no kami (Hashiba, governor of Shimosa Province)(Katsutoshi TAKIGAWA).

sen.j: この息女に宗厳はまめまめしく仕えたが、宗厳30歳のとき、息女は17歳で死んだ。
sen.e: Although Sogon served the daughter faithfully, she died at the age of 17 when Sogon was 30 years old.
Although Sogon served the daughter faithfully, she died at the age of 17 when Sogon was 30 years old.
Although Sogon served the daughter faithfully, she died at the age of 17 when Sogon was 30 years old.

sen.j: それに彼は人生の無常を感じた。
sen.e: Sogon felt absence of absolutes in life then.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Sogon felt the vanity of life then.
sen.cmt: 無常の表現変更しました。
sen.e: Sogon felt the vanity of life then.

sen.j: 知恩院第29世の満誉尊照を師として宗厳は出家した。
sen.e: Sogon entered into priesthood having Manyo Sonsho, the 29th generation of Chionin, as his master.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Sogon entered into priesthood having Manyo Sonsho, the 29th generation of Chionin, as his master.
Sogon entered into priesthood having Manyo Sonsho, the 29th generation of Chionin, as his master.

sen.j: 11年間諸国を巡る修行の後の元和 (日本)2年（1616年）、黒谷に帰ってきた。
sen.e: After practicing for eleven years while touring many provinces, in 1616, he came back to Kurodani.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After touring many provinces to practice for eleven years, in 1616, he came back to Kurodani.
After touring many provinces to practice for eleven years, in 1616, he came back to Kurodani.

sen.j: 宗厳はひたすら龍光院 (京都市左京区)の墓前で念仏を唱え続けた。
sen.e: He kept praying to Amida Buddha in front of the grave in Ryuko-in Temple (Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City).
He kept praying to Amida Buddha in front of graves in Ryuko-in Temple (Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City).
sen.cmt: 不特定多数化しました。
sen.e: He kept praying to Amida Buddha in front of graves in Ryuko-in Temple (Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City).

sen.j: たいへん熱心なその様子を見た了的（金戒光明寺第27世）は紫雲石を宗厳に授けた。
sen.e: Ryoteki (the 27th generation of Konkai Komyo-ji Temple), who saw Sogon's eagerness, gave shiun-seki (the stone related to Honen-shonin) to him.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Ryoteki (the 27th generation of Konkai Komyo-ji Temple), who was impressed Sogon's eagerness, gave shiun-seki (the stone related to Honen-shonin) to him.
Ryoteki (the 27th generation of Konkai Komyo-ji Temple), who was impressed Sogon's eagerness, gave shiun-seki (the stone related to Honen-shonin) to him.

sen.j: 宗厳は西雲院を開山した。
sen.e: Sogon founded Saiun-in Temple.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Sogon founded Saiun-in Temple.
Sogon founded Saiun-in Temple.

sen.j: さらに一心不乱に念仏を唱える宗厳の下には多くの僧侶が集まった。
sen.e: Also, many monks gathered to Sogon, who put his heart and soul in praying to Amida Buddha.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Also, many monks gathered around Sogon, who put his heart and soul into praying to Amida Buddha.
Also, many monks gathered around Sogon, who put his heart and soul into praying to Amida Buddha.

sen.j: また多くの寄進を集めたという。
sen.e: Also, it is said that Sogon gathered a lot of donations.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Also, it is said that Sogon gathered a lot of donations.
Also, it is said that Sogon gathered a lot of donations.

sen.j: 千日念仏惣回向、そして宗厳は寛永5年（1628年）に死去したが、その死後も、万日念仏惣回向、3万日念仏惣回向、4万日念仏惣回向（100年）と続けられた。
sen.e: A thousand days nenbutsusoeko, and Sogon died in 1628, but even after his death, it was kept until ten thousand days nenbutsusoeko, thirty thousand days nenbutsusoeko, and forty thousand days nenbutsusoeko (100 years).
sen.cmt: 文章の意味がわかりませんでした。
sen.e: After a thousand days nenbutsusoeko, Sogon died in 1628, but even after his death, ten thousand days nenbutsusoeko, thirty thousand days nenbutsusoeko, and forty thousand days nenbutsusoeko (100 years) were kept going.
sen.cmt: 文の意味を推測し、直しました。
sen.e: After a thousand days nenbutsusoeko, Sogon died in 1628, but even after his death, ten thousand days nenbutsusoeko, thirty thousand days nenbutsusoeko, and forty thousand days nenbutsusoeko (100 years) were kept going.
